Inside Cyber Warfare: Mapping the Cyber Underworld


Inside Cyber Warfare: Mapping the Cyber Underworld By Jeffrey Carr
Publisher: O'Re..illy Media; 2 edition 2011 | 316 Pages | ISBN: 1449310044 | EPUB + PDF | 6 MB + 14 MB




When the Stuxnet computer worm damaged the Iranian nuclear program in 2010, the public got a small glimpse into modern cyber warfareÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½without truly realizing the scope of this global conflict. Inside Cyber Warfare provides fascinating and disturbing details on how nations, groups, and individuals throughout the world increasingly rely on Internet attacks to gain military, political, and economic advantages over their adversaries.
This updated second edition takes a detailed look at the complex domain of cyberspace, and the players and strategies involved. Jeffrey Carr, the founder and CEO of Taia Global, Inc., is a cyber intelligence expert and consultant who specializes in the investigation of cyber attacks against governments and infrastructures by state and non-state hackers.
